com.adobe.cq.commerce.api.promotion

Interface Promotion

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Adaptable

    @ProviderType
public interface Promotion
extends Adaptable
    Interface that describes a promotion. Note: this interface only describes a promotion outside of the context of a shopping cart (or placed order). To get real-time info regarding the application of promotions to a cart, use PromotionInfo. JCR-based promotions use a PromotionHandler to define their business logic (such as generating author- and/or shopper-oriented messages, applying discounts to the cart and/or order, etc.). Use the PromotionManager to look up an appropriate handler based on the promotion's type.
    Since:
    5.6

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        java.lang.String getPath()
        Get the path of the promotion if represented in the repository. Otherwise, an ID uniquely identifying the promotion to the external commerce engine.
        Returns:

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Return a title used to describe the promotion to authors.
        Returns:

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Return a description used to describe the promotion to authors.
        Returns:

      • getType

        java.lang.String getType()
        Return the configured promotion type.

        For JCR-based promotions, the type is used to select a PromotionHandler which defines the business logic for the promotion.

        For external promotions, the type is implementation-dependent (and may be null).

        Returns:

      • getPriority

        long getPriority()
        Return the promotion's priority.
        Returns:

      • getSegments

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSegments()
        If a promotion wishes to be assigned based on CQ segmentation, it should return the list of segements it is active for here. Otherwise, return null.
        Returns:

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Return if the promotion is currently valid. This is often used to enforce start and expiration dates, but actual semantics are implementation-dependent.
        Returns:

      • getConfigResource

        @Deprecated
Resource getConfigResource()
        Deprecated. since 5.6.200; use getConfig() instead.
        Returns:
        A resource representing the Promotion's configuration

      • getConfig

        ValueMap getConfig()
        Return a map of implementation-specific configuration properties.
        Returns:
